page.title: 04THE USE OF THE SEA
page.content: {THE USE OF THE SEA AROUND THE SOUTH {END OF WALNEY ISLAND. The sea around the south end of Walney Island is mainly used for pleasure craft.Piel deepwater channel has attracted the shipbuilding company of Vickers Ltd. because it is an ideal place in which to launch ships and submarines.In the 19th century the channel was used regularly by hundreds of iron-ore boats.This made the protection provided by the Walney Lighthouse especially important. The majority of the pleasure craft mentioned above are moored at the marina/boat-club on Roa Island. Surprisingly little commercial fishing is done in this region,however,there are many pleasure-only anglers to be found here every weekend.
